title: 103_hr3410
content:
The Act titled "Dairy Promotion Program Improvement Act of 1993" provides funding for the Dairy Promotion and Research Program. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products and products produced in or imported into the country. Definitions are also updated to include imported dairy products such as milk, cream, butter, butterfat mixtures, and cheese. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products like milk, cream, butter, butterfat mixtures, cheese, casein, and other dairy products. The term 'importer' is defined as a person importing these products into the United States. Funding for representation on the board is also adjusted. The Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 is amended to include imported dairy products. 2 members of the Board shall be representatives of importers of these products, appointed by the Secretary from nominations submitted by importers. Importers are required to pay an assessment to the Board as prescribed by the order. Imported dairy products are subject to an assessment determined by the Board. The value of imported dairy products for assessment purposes is set by the Secretary. Additionally, records for imported dairy products are to be maintained by importers. A referendum can be requested by a representative group comprising 10% or more of producers subject to the order. The Secretary can conduct a referendum to suspend amendments to the Dairy Promotion Program Improvement Act of 1993 if requested by a representative group comprising 10% or more of producers subject to the order. The suspension will continue only if favored by a majority of producers engaged in milk production for commercial use. SEC. 3. TERMINATION OF DAIRY PROMOTION AND RESEARCH PROGRAM.

    The Secretary will terminate the order under the Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983 on December 31, 1996, including the collection of assessments. Activities under the order will be terminated in an orderly manner.

SEC. 4. PROHIBITION ON BLOC VOTING.

    The Secretary will not conduct bloc voting under the Dairy Production Stabilization Act of 1983.
